abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Health Sector
            Support Project for Guinea is to help decrease maternal and
            infant mortality rates by: (a) avoiding the death of at
            least 12,000 pregnant women, and (b) avoiding the death of
            27,500 children. The changes are as follows: (i) a revision
            of Project Development Objectives (PDOs) and related
            indicators; (ii) a streamlining of project activities; (iii)
            a revision of institutional arrangements; (iv) a
            reallocation of credit proceeds; and (v) an extension of the
            closing date. The expected outcome of the restructuring will
            be a more effective project implementation resulting in an
            improvement in mother and child health services in the 18
            poorest districts of Guinea and 16 health centers in the
            poorest peri-urban areas of Conakry, leading eventually to
            reductions in maternal and child mortality and improvements
            in health status.
